resources.string: Coto Makassar is a traditional beef soup from Makassar, South Sulawesi. It is made from a combination of beef, offal, and a rich broth made with peanuts and various spices. It is usually served with ketupat (rice cakes).

Pallubasa is another traditional soup dish from Makassar, similar to Coto but with a richer and thicker broth. It is made from beef or buffalo meat, cooked with coconut milk and served with raw egg and rice.

Sop Konro is a savory beef rib soup that is flavored with rich spices like coriander, cinnamon, and nutmeg. The ribs are tender, and the broth is bold and hearty, making it a favorite in Makassar cuisine.
Pisang Epe is a popular street food made from grilled flattened bananas, typically served with palm sugar syrup. It is a sweet and simple snack, often enjoyed while strolling along Losari Beach.
Pisang Ijo is a refreshing dessert made from bananas wrapped in green rice flour dough, served with coconut milk and syrup. It is a must-try dessert in Makassar, especially during the hot weather.
Benteng Rotterdam is a historical fortress located in Makassar. Built during the Dutch colonial period, this site is a popular tourist destination and a symbol of the city is rich history.
Pantai Losari is a famous beach in Makassar, known for its picturesque sunsets and vibrant atmosphere. It is a favorite spot for locals and tourists alike to relax by the seaside.
CPI, or Center Point of Indonesia, is a modern landmark in Makassar. This urban development area offers shopping, dining, and recreational activities by the waterfront.
Masjid 99 Kubah is a mosque in Makassar known for its unique architectural design featuring 99 domes. It is an iconic religious site and a beautiful place to visit, especially during sunset.
Ramang-Ramang is a natural wonder located in South Sulawesi. It is one of the largest karst areas in the world, featuring stunning limestone cliffs and scenic boat rides along the river.
Join us for an exciting Cultural Festival at Fort Rotterdam on 28 Oct 2024!
Savor delicious local and international cuisines at the Food Festival on 5 Nov 2024 at Pantai Losari!
Enjoy a night of great music at the Music Concert on 12 Nov 2024 at Trans Studio!
